data.title: Telefilm Canada selects nine English-language feature-length films under the Big Budget stream of the Production Program
data.meta_description: October 13, 2022 – Telefilm Canada announces the latest round of funding for nine feature-length films in the English market under the Big Budget stream of the Production Program’s 2022 submissions, representing a total commitment of $16.08 million.   Earlier this summer, Telefilm committed to 12 English-language feature-length films and nine French-language feature-length films under the […]
data.text:
October 13, 2022 – Telefilm Canada announces the latest round of funding for nine feature-length films in the English market under the Big Budget stream of the Production Program’s 2022 submissions, representing a total commitment of $16.08 million.

Earlier this summer, Telefilm committed to 12 English-language feature-length films and nine French-language feature-length films under the same stream of the Production Program.

An advisory committee of external and internal representatives assessed the projects and made recommendations to Telefilm. The decision-making process considered Telefilm’s goal of fostering a diversity of voices in the industry, ensuring that Telefilm funds a balanced portfolio of productions that reflect a variety of genres, budgets and company sizes, regions of the country and points of view. Names of selection committee members will be published on the Project Financing Advisory Committees webpage once all funding decisions have been made.

Funding announcement regarding the Talent to Watch Program will be published shortly.

1989 (comedy)

Director: Sam McGlynn

Screenwriter: Paul Spence

Production: Eagle Vision Inc. and Paul Spence and Associates Inc.

Distributor: Mongrel Media

Provinces: Manitoba and Quebec

40 Acres (thriller)

Director: R.T. Thorne

Screenwriters: R.T. Thorne and Glenn Taylor

Production: 40 Acres Productions Inc., Hungry Eyes Media Inc., Creative Rain Cloud Inc., and Waterford Valley Pictures Inc.

Distributor: Mongrel Media

Province: Ontario

Freaks Unknown (thriller)

Directors and screenwriters: Zach Lipovsky and Adam Stein

Production: Freak Productions Inc. and Elevation Pictures

Distributor: Elevation Pictures

Province: British Columbia

I, Object (drama)

Director and screenwriter: Andrew Niccol

Production: Scythia Films Inc. (Canada) and Southern Light Films Ltd. (New Zealand)

Distributor: Mongrel Media

Province: Ontario

In the Black (drama)

Director: Frances-Anne Solomon

Screenwriter: Andrew Burrows-Trotman

Production: 1371097 Ontario Ltd O/A CaribbeanTales (Canada) and I Made It Films (UK)

Distributor: Photon Films

Province: Ontario

Mother, Mother (drama)

Director and screenwriter: K’naan Warsame

Production: Rhombus Media Inc. and EMA Films Inc.

Distributor: Elevation Pictures and Entract Films

Provinces: Ontario and Quebec

Sharp Corner (thriller)

Director and screenwriter: Jason Buxton

Production: Alcina Pictures Ltd. and Workhorse Pictures Inc.

Distributor: Elevation Pictures

Provinces: Ontario and Nova Scotia

The Shrouds (drama)

Director and screenwriter: David Cronenberg

Production: Plausible Communications Corp. (Canada) and SBS Productions (France)

Distributor: Sphere Films

Province: Ontario

There Were Witches (horror)

Director: Jefferson Moneo

Screenwriter: Marcelo Tobar

Production: Prowler Pictures Inc. (Canada) and Fidelio Films (Mexico)

Distributor: Level Film Inc.

Province: Ontario

About Telefilm Canada

As a Partner of Choice, Telefilm Canada is a Crown corporation dedicated to the success of Canada’s audiovisual industry, fostering access and excellence by delivering programs that support cultural resonance and audience engagement. With a lens of equity, inclusivity and sustainability, Telefilm bolsters dynamic companies and a range of creative talent at home and around the world. Telefilm also makes recommendations regarding the certification of audiovisual coproduction treaties to the Minister of Canadian Heritage, and administers the programs of the Canada Media Fund. Launched in 2012, the Talent Fund raises private donations which principally support emerging talent. Visit telefilm.ca and follow us on Twitter at twitter.com/Telefilm_Canada and on Facebook at facebook.com/telefilmcanada.
